poem:
Beneath the Lisbon Sun

Lisbon with daughter's eyes, unfurled, 
Caught in the lens of a father's world.
Marble memories etch in stone, 
Echoing labour that's seldom known. 
The city's heart and story unfurls,
Threading life's changes in delicate twirls. 
A cinematic ode, sung clear:
Lisbon survives, in love and fear.

Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
